title: Thunderbird 115.18.0 Linux - Cannot decrypt PGP encrypted message
content:
I received a PGP-encrypted e-mail which is just showing the encrypted text in mail preview and also in a separate mail window; it is not getting auto-decrypted, even though the correct key is present in the OpenPGP key management. I have this same behavior on two different setups on Linux Mint 21.1 Vera. Once I reply to the e-mail, the original message gets decrypted in the reply message, but not in the original.

I've got another setup on MacOS, same Thunderbird version, which also does not auto-decrypt the message, but in message preview provides a button "Decrypt" which does the job. But this button is missing in the Linux configs.

All setups have the correct PGP Key configured.

Any hint to resolve the issue is highly appreciated. Thanks for your time.
creator: thomas_runge

content:

Also, I have absolutely no problems sending emails directly from the server, this happens only in Thunderbird and it is up-to-date, version 128.8.0esr 64-bit on Windows 11. It used to happen on my old PC running Windows 10 which I stopped using a week ago. On my new one I set the local directory to the archive I backed up from the old PC to the new one.

Has anyone experienced the same problem or has any suggestions how to fix this? Thanks in advance.

title: Altering Thunderbird mailbox saved folders from hard drive to cloud
content:
Hello:

a question on the programs default design & possible alteration...

the mailbox program by default creates a folder on the hard drive in the *user* profiles folder.... in appdata/roaming in *Windows 10*, this folder contains all of the various mailbox information, the number of individual mailboxes that the user has created & makes use of. This folder (in my case) gets quite large (I have a lot of stored messages saved from 2 particular mailboxes in there). At the moment that folder is well over 1 gig large..... I'm making use of the imap configuration, is it possible to save all of these messages to *the cloud* instead of the messages taking up physical space on my hard drive? All of my source mailbox accounts make use of *cloud* storage to save any users information.... can one do the same with Thunderbird?

thx
creator: 50fivetrucker

title: Slow Internet Download Speeds Running Mozilla
content: I have tracked down the situation where my Internet download speeds drop from about 598 Mbps to around 267 Mbps after I open Mozilla. I am running a desktop computer with Windows 11 (updated) and Edge and Chrome. I am hardwired directly to my Xfinity modem (no WiFi connection). When I close Mozilla, my speed goes to 598 Mbps, and when I open Mozilla, my speed drops to 267 Mbps. This seems excessive and unacceptable. Are there any settings or anything to adjust, not to have Mozilla be such a drain on my system?
creator: thuey18

title: problem with outgoing emails not showing in sent mail
content:
We have 2 gmail accounts in Thunderbird. outgoing emails don't show in sent mail.

I read the solution for my same problem- quoted below. This does not fix the problem for me. Every time I change the SMTP outgoing address for one account the other account gets changed to match it.

"It is exactly as I suspected: all the SMTP servers have the same description. To fix the problem, you need to edit each of them in the account settings>Outgoing Server (SMTP) pane and give each a different DESCRIPTION. Since they all have the same name, Thunderbird goes with the default. I suggest putting each email id within the description field for easy identification. Do that for all four SMTP servers. Then, click the account page for each, and at bottom of pane, click and set the appropriate SMTP server.

title: Thunderbird error message -unable to send mssages
content:
Three days ago, when I tried to send a email using Firefox v128 and my main email account using my desktop PC, no message was sent but I got the following error message from Thunderbird:- 

   "Send message error. 
   Sending the message failed. Outgoing server (SMPT) error. The server responded: No SMPT service for unauthorized users."

Five days earlier, I was able to send messages from my main account with no problems, and had not tried sending any more until the day this problem arose. I have tried sending a message via my main account a couple of times with the same result. I then found my laptop had developed the same problem

Incoming messages on my main account have arrived alright - no problems, so presumably my password is correct.

As far as I am aware I have not made any changes to the settings in Firefox on either computer. I can send and receive messages using my g mail account without problems. I have Windows 11 Home 24H2 (64 bit) on my desktop PC and Windows 10 PRO 22H2 (64 bit) on my (oldish) laptop. Both updated the day I found the problem, and it still persists. 

John Lewis

creator: norm3

title: Thunderbird won't set up properly
content:
I have windows 10 with 4 Email accounts on my desktop computer. One is TB using ee.net 3rd party provider, two are TB using Gmail and one using Outlook. The Gmail accounts and Outlook work ok. The remaining account with ee.net has been a problem for weeks now. It will not install. EE.net says NOT their problem because all Emails are received and sent OK on their webmail server. They will not help further. I cannot find what is at fault, TB, ee.net or both.

I can't create an IMAP account even though ee.net says their server handles POP3 and IMAP. After long trial-error, POP3 installed manually but sending/receiving messages has server errors. Incoming: mail.ee.net port 110, no security, password insecure. Outgoing: SMTP.mail.ee.net port 587 ssl/tls Auth2 Messages to it have "server refused" error & messages sent say "outgoing SMTP server failed".

Here's the biggest mystery: At one time I found a "magic combination" where all at once everything started working and all waiting messages suddenly downloaded. However, without changing anything, an hour later it returned to earlier non-working condition. It did that once before when I logged out of the ee.net web site and then logged back in. It then asked me for the password again and when I did that, everything started working but quit a day later. 

Re-entering the ee.net password again didn't fix it. So, now I ask, how can a fix work only temporarily??? I've chased this problem for weeks now.

Art Towslee towslee1@ee.net
creator: WA8RMC
